results.title: Metformin-Induced Hemolysis in a Patient With Glucose-6-Phosphate Dehydrogenase Deficiency Presenting With Concurrent Idiopathic Steven-Johnson Syndrome/Toxic Epidermal Necrolysis
results.text_hl: This report aims to alert that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ can induce @DISEASE_Hemolysis @DISEASE_MESH:D006461 @@@hemolysis@@@ in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Glucosephosphate_Dehydrogenase_Deficiency</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005955 @@@G6PD deficiency@@@.

citations.NLM: Roy Choudhury A, Gadaga C, Moodley L, Moodley A. Metformin-Induced Hemolysis in a Patient With Glucose-6-Phosphate Dehydrogenase Deficiency Presenting With Concurrent Idiopathic Steven-Johnson Syndrome/Toxic Epidermal Necrolysis Cureus. 2021 Oct;13(10):e18506. PMID: 34754666
citations.BibTeX: @article{34754666, title={Metformin-Induced Hemolysis in a Patient With Glucose-6-Phosphate Dehydrogenase Deficiency Presenting With Concurrent Idiopathic Steven-Johnson Syndrome/Toxic Epidermal Necrolysis}, author={Roy Choudhury A and Gadaga C and Moodley L and Moodley A}, journal={Cureus}, volume={13}, number={10}, pages={e18506}}

results.title: Inhibition of midkine by metformin can contribute to its anticancer effects in malignancies: A proposal mechanism of action of metformin in context of endometrial cancer prevention and therapy.
results.text_hl: In this respect, the therapeutic use of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ may improve the survival of @<m>DISEASE_Glucosephosphate_Dehydrogenase_Deficiency</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005955 @@@EC@@@ or other @DISEASE_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@cancers@@@, via inhibiting or overcoming the unwanted effects of @GENE_MDK @GENE_4192 @@@MK@@@ in @DISEASE_Carcinogenesis @DISEASE_MESH:D063646 @@@carcinogenesis@@@.

citations.NLM: Karadeniz Z, Aynacıoğlu AŞ, Bilir A, Tuna MY. Inhibition of midkine by metformin can contribute to its anticancer effects in malignancies: A proposal mechanism of action of metformin in context of endometrial cancer prevention and therapy. Med Hypotheses. 2020 Jan;134():109420. PMID: 31634770
citations.BibTeX: @article{31634770, title={Inhibition of midkine by metformin can contribute to its anticancer effects in malignancies: A proposal mechanism of action of metformin in context of endometrial cancer prevention and therapy.}, author={Karadeniz Z and Aynacıoğlu AŞ and Bilir A and Tuna MY}, journal={Med Hypotheses}, volume={134}, pages={109420}}

results.title: Metformin-induced hemolytic anemia in a patient with glucose-6- phosphate dehydrogenase deficiency.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@-induced @DISEASE_Anemia_Hemolytic @DISEASE_MESH:D000743 @@@hemolytic anemia@@@ in a @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Glucosephosphate_Dehydrogenase_Deficiency</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005955 @@@glucose-6- phosphate dehydrogenase deficiency@@@.

citations.NLM: Meir A, Kleinman Y, Rund D, Da'as N. Metformin-induced hemolytic anemia in a patient with glucose-6- phosphate dehydrogenase deficiency. Diabetes Care. 2003 Mar;26(3):956-7. PMID: 12610074
citations.BibTeX: @article{12610074, title={Metformin-induced hemolytic anemia in a patient with glucose-6- phosphate dehydrogenase deficiency.}, author={Meir A and Kleinman Y and Rund D and Da'as N}, journal={Diabetes Care}, volume={26}, number={3}, pages={956-7}}

results.title: Protopanaxadiol and metformin synergistically inhibit estrogen-mediated proliferation and anti-autophagy effects in endometrial cancer cells.
results.text_hl: These data suggest that @CHEMICAL_protopanaxadiol @CHEMICAL_MESH:C062916 @@@PPD@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ can be used together to play a more powerful anti-@<m>DISEASE_Glucosephosphate_Dehydrogenase_Deficiency</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005955 @@@EC@@@ effect.

citations.NLM: Gu CJ, Cheng J, Zhang B, Yang SL, Xie F, Sun JS, Huang LQ, Yu JJ, Li MQ. Protopanaxadiol and metformin synergistically inhibit estrogen-mediated proliferation and anti-autophagy effects in endometrial cancer cells. Am J Transl Res. 2017;9(9):4071-4082. PMID: 28979682
